Title: Interview panel
Paragraph: On entering an interview room, you are welcomed by the panel of interviewers. You are the third candidate to be seen today, and as you sit down, you feel your cheeks turning red. You think that they probably see you as calm.
Questions: Do you think the interviewers see you as a nervous person?

Title: Returning to school
Paragraph: You have decided to go back to school for another degree. Although you have been saving for this for the past few years, you worry about not having an income while you are back in school. The likelihood that you will go broke while in school is small.
Questions: Will you become broke once you go back to school?

Title: New outfit
Paragraph: You arrive at a party in a new outfit. Everyone turns to look at you as you walk in. You decide that they must think that you look sleek.
Questions: Did everyone at the party like your new outfit?

Title: Class presentation
Paragraph: For a course requirement, you have to make a presentation to your classmates and your teacher. As you start, you stumble on your first few words. Continuing with it, you think that your performance will be evaluated positively.
Questions: Do you think others will like your presentation?

Title: Trying on a new outfit
Paragraph: You are shopping with a friend, and you try on a new outfit. As you come out of the fitting room, your friend pauses, and then, without smiling, says that you look good. Inside the fitting room, thinking back to your friend’s response, you think your friend is being polite.
Questions: Does your friend think you look nice?

Title: Project deadline
Paragraph: You have a big project due at the end of the week. Your work isn’t finished, but you consider taking a break to go out with friends. Taking the night off would be reasonable.
Questions: Is it OK that you stopped working to go out with friends?

Title: Turning in a paper
Paragraph: You are going to turn in a paper. As you walk, you glance down and realize there is a small typo on the last page of your paper. You believe that you should be fine.
Questions: Should you be troubled about the small typo?

Title: Going to the movie theater
Paragraph: You are watching a movie in a theater. There are many sweeping camera shots that make you feel dizzy. This sensation is funny.
Questions: Does it alarm you when you feel dizzy?

Title: Dancing class
Paragraph: You are taking a dancing class and, during a break, find yourself talking to a newcomer about your job. As you chat, you notice that you are sweating. She probably assumes this is a result of dancing.
Questions: Did the person you met at dance class think you were anxious?

Title: Job interview
Paragraph: You are being interviewed for a really great job. Before you walk into the room, you notice you feel shaky. You feel incredibly excited.
Questions: Does feeling shaky frighten you?

Title: Finishing a task
Paragraph: You have started a new job, and you are given a task that normally takes a few days, but you manage to finish it the same day. You show it to your boss, who finds only one mistake in your work. As the meeting ends, you expect he thinks your work is commendable.
Questions: Was your boss pleased with your work?

Title: Promoting fundraising events
Paragraph: As a member of a local charity, you are asked to promote your fundraising events on local radio. You know that the station is widely listened to. You expect that the other committee members will think you spoke convincingly.
Questions: Do you think your committee members thought you were a bad speaker?

Title: Calling your grandmother
Paragraph: Every Monday you call your grandmother to say hello. Today is Monday, and she did not pick up the phone when you called, which is unusual. Your grandmother probably did not answer the phone because she is busy.
Questions: Is your grandmother unable to talk because she is ill?

Title: Speech for a class
Paragraph: You have to give a speech for a class you are taking, and you spend a long time preparing. As you walk into the classroom to begin your speech, your anxiety is tolerable.
Questions: Is your anxiety intolerable?

Title: Car repairs
Paragraph: Your car needs expensive repairs. You have savings but are reluctant to use them. When you pay for the car repairs, you will be fine.
Questions: Will you go bankrupt after paying for the car repairs?

Title: New haircut
Paragraph: While at the hairdresser's, you opt for a completely different haircut. When you see your friend afterwards, she gasps. Her gasp probably means that she thinks the new style makes you look great.
Questions: Does your friend like your new haircut?

Title: Feeling thirsty
Paragraph: After a long day you are very thirsty, so you drink a lot of water very quickly. After a couple large gulps, you have trouble swallowing more water. You feel you are refreshed.
Questions: Are you worried that you will choke when you can't swallow any more water?

Title: Scratchy throat
Paragraph: Getting up this morning, you notice that your throat is scratchier than it usually is. You think about why this may be. You decide it is probably because you are thirsty
Questions: Will drinking some water make your throat feel better?

Title: Waiting room
Paragraph: You are sitting in a waiting room that is out of tissue. Suddenly, you sneeze into your hand. You guess that the other patients sitting near you will think you are considerate.
Questions: Do the other patients think you are disgusting?

Title: Invite to dinner
Paragraph: One evening, your colleagues decide to go out to eat and ask you to join them. You accept, but will have to wear your work clothes. When you arrive, the other diners turn to look at you. You think this is because they think you look stylish.
Questions: Do you think that other diners think you are dressed inappropriately?

Title: Attending an anniversary dinner
Paragraph: Your partner asks you to go to an anniversary dinner that your partner's company is holding. You have not met any of your partner's work colleagues before. Getting ready to go, you think that the new people you will meet will find you friendly.
Questions: Will you be disliked by your new acquaintances?

Title: Medical test
Paragraph: At your routine doctor’s appointment, you are asked to take a test for a disease. After the test, you wait for your results in the waiting room. You think the chances that you have the disease are minimal.
Questions: Do you think the test results will say you have the disease?

Title: Morning meeting
Paragraph: You arrive to a morning meeting exactly on time, but you are the last one to arrive. Your coworkers look at you as you pull out your chair, and it squeaks loudly. They probably think that you are easygoing.
Questions: Do your coworkers find you strange?

Title: Completing a task
Paragraph: You are new to a job, and your boss asks you to do a task. You finish it before the deadline, but make a small mistake in your work. You believe that your boss will think you are progressing.
Questions: Was your new boss pleased with your performance?

Title: English assignment
Paragraph: You have an English assignment to write, and you try very hard to make sure it is comprehensive. The final copy is quite long. When your teacher reads it, you think she will judge your efforts as unreasonable.
Questions: Will your teacher judge your efforts as reasonable?

Title: Date in a pub
Paragraph: You arrange to meet your date at 8 PM in a local pub. You arrive on time and find that your date is not there yet. Reflecting on your last conversation as you wait for a table, you remember that your date found you interesting.
Questions: Was your date interested in you after your last conversation?

Title: Dental appointment
Paragraph: You have a routine dentist appointment and find out that you need some tests to check the health of your gums and teeth. After the dentist performs the tests, you continue to lie in the dentist chair while waiting for the results. You think your teeth and gums are probably unhealthy.
Questions: Do you think you have gum disease?

Title: Using the restroom
Paragraph: On your way out from work, you stop in the restroom. As you leave the bathroom stall, your coworker passes you and gives you a funny look. Your coworker is probably distracted.
Questions: Is your coworker negatively judging you as you leave the restroom?

Title: Intensive exercise
Paragraph: Yesterday you were exercising and did quite a few push-ups, which was really tough. Today, your arms feel sore. You are pleased.
Questions: Are you bothered by the soreness in your arms?

Title: Writing on a board
Paragraph: During a meeting your boss calls on you to write a few notes on the board. As you write down what she says and hope you are not mispelling any words, everyone watching you probably thinks you are doing well.
Questions: Do your coworkers judge you negatively while you write on the board?
